intro: Echinocodon, commonly known as the spiny scale plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is native to southern Africa and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Echinocodon species are typically shrubs or small trees, and they produce capsules as their fruit. These plants are adapted to drought conditions and have a slow growth rate.
